title: Ticket #1946: Allow wildcards in node names for VARS values
description:
This is actually something Pete and I talked about a long time ago, at least when we were first implementing splices; but it doesn't seem to be recorded anywhere.

Anyhow, the idea is to allow something like this: 

  VARS NodeA.*.3 foo="bar"
remarks:
2014-Sep-18 14:47:41 by wenger:
It seems to me that there are basically two questions:

  1. Does the "global variable definition" apply to all nodes, or only to already-created nodes?

  2. Do we have a full regex, or just some fixed string like "*" that applies to all nodes?

As far as # 2 goes, we could always start out by implementing a fixed string that applies to all nodes, and then add the regex later. I guess the main question then is whether the "all nodes" version is generally useful. You could have some "granularity" within the DAG by using some different submit files with differently-named variables, so maybe the "all nodes" version would be fairly useful.

For # 1, having the vars definition apply only to already-created nodes would be way simpler to implement (and in line with how VARS currently work); my main concern would be whether it might cause confusion.

2016-Jun-02 09:53:17 by wenger:
If we do this, it should also be implemented in a bunch of things besides VARS -- right now we have a CHTC user who really wants this for ABORT-DAG-ON.

2017-May-16 11:30:11 by wenger:
I'm reducing the priority of this and unassigning it because the ALL_NODES option may take care of things for now.
